title: Raster Stretch Renderer
description: Displays continuous raster cell values across a gradual ramp of colors. Use this renderer to draw a single band of continuous data. This renderer works well when you have a large range of values to display, such as with imagery or scientific data.

computeGamma.description: Indicates if gamma values should be computed by default.

dra.description: Indicates if Dynamic Range Adjustment should be applied.

numberOfStandardDeviations.description: The number of standard deviations for standard deviation stretch.

sigmoidStrengthLevel.description: Set this from (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.

stretchType.description: The stretch types for stretch raster function.

type.description: Specifies the type of renderer used.

useGamma.description: Indicates if the renderer applies Gamma stretch.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
For each `stretchType` there are specific sets of requirements that are as follows:
`none`: does not require other parameters.
`standardDeviation`: requires numberOfStandardDeviations, statistics, or dra.
`histogramEqualization`: requires the source dataset to have histograms or additional dra.
`minMax`: requires statistics or dra.
`percentClip`: requires minPercent, maxPercent, and dra.
`sigmoid`: does not require other parameters. Optionally, set the sigmoidStrengthLevel (1 to 6) to adjust the curvature of Sigmoid curve used in color stretch.
